definition: currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
vowel harmony (in phonetics of Altaic languages)
retroflex vowel (e.g. the final r of putonghua)
retroflex vowel (e.g. the final r of putonghua)
diphthong (such as putonghua ɑi, ei etc)

sentences.english: This chapter introduces the vocalic inventory of Polish.
sentences.chinese: 這一章講了波蘭語的元音表。

sentences.english: Hangul is composed of graphemes of characters which represent. consonants and vowels in korean.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮文是一種由元音和輔音構成的字母文字。

sentences.english: The only word with all the vowels in reverse order is subcontinental.
sentences.chinese: 唯一一個包括所有逆序元音的單詞是“次大陸的”。

sentences.english: She learns six short vowels and some related example words in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 今晚，她學習了六個短元音及一些相關的例詞。

sentences.english: Several pairs of such vowels existed in early English.
sentences.chinese: 在早期英語中，有好幾對這樣的元音。

sentences.english: And then you slur by dropping initial letters and diphthongs.
sentences.chinese: 有時你又把單詞開頭的輔音和雙元音含糊掉。

sentences.english: This paper proposes a subgrouping of the (Gyal)Rongic branch the light of vowel innovations of the Rongic languages.
sentences.chinese: 本文依據戎語支的元音創新對戎語支語言進行劃分。

sentences.english: We also have an example of consonant to vowel linking in the phrase, can you hear it?
sentences.chinese: 這裏也出現了由輔音和元音形成的連讀，能聽出來嗎？

sentences.english: No other characters will be accepted, including umlauts.
sentences.chinese: 沒有其他的字符將被接受，包括元音變音。

sentences.english: There are five letters of vowels and twenty-one letters of consonants.
sentences.chinese: 英語中有五個元音字母好二十一個輔音字母。

sentences.english: A tense vowel requires you to use a lot of facial muscles to produce.
sentences.chinese: 要發一個長元音，你得動用很多面部肌肉。

sentences.english: There is a difference of duration and also of pronunciation between corresponding long and short vowels.
sentences.chinese: 在符合之間有一種期間以及發音的不同長的和短元音。

sentences.english: The schwa is the most frequent vowel sound in English speech.
sentences.chinese: 在英語中，中元音是最常用的元音。

sentences.english: The schwa is the most frequent vowel sound in English speech.
sentences.chinese: 在英語中，中元音是最常用的元音。

sentences.english: The short vowels have more centralized phonetic qualities than the long vowels.
sentences.chinese: 有更多的集中在較長期元音音素質短元音。

sentences.english: The short vowels have more centralized phonetic qualities than the long vowels.
sentences.chinese: 有更多的集中在較長期元音音素質短元音。

definition: the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
